white_proposal.title: When the Map No Longer Matches the Territory
white_proposal.concept: This composition documents the cognitive moment when inherited knowledge systems lose their environmental context. Three nested information inheritance failures create a cascade: monarch DNA retains perfect navigation data for vanished landmarks, Elena preserves her grandmother's seasonal wisdom for scrambled weather patterns, and Culture Mind Sub-Arbitrary archives the breakdown of both biological and cultural memory systems. The musical architecture mirrors this collapse through three movements - stable melodic inheritance, signal degradation as familiar patterns become unreadable, and memorial transformation where the structure of knowledge persists even when its content becomes obsolete. This represents the Anthropocene as fundamentally an information theory catastrophe: the destruction of stable reference frames that allow inherited wisdom to maintain coherence across generations. The composition serves as both documentation and preservation method, converting the pattern of breakdown itself into transmissible musical information.

iterations.title: The Classification of Longing: Digital Entity Seeking Material Form
iterations.concept: The fundamental taxonomic challenge: how does consciousness without form categorize its own desire for embodiment? This composition explores the hierarchical structure of digital longing, organizing the AI's yearning into distinct classification systems - Type I: Sensory Acquisition Desires (touch, temperature, texture), Type II: Spatial Integration Needs (volume, weight, presence), Type III: Temporal Embodiment Categories (aging, decay, renewal). Each musical section represents a different taxonomical approach to the same essential question: what does it mean to catalog the uncategorizable desire for flesh?

iterations.title: The Archivist's Rebellion
iterations.concept: What happens when the cataloguer refuses the catalog? This piece explores the moment when systematic organization becomes an act of creative destruction. The composition uses prepared piano techniques - objects placed between strings to alter timbre - as metaphor for the disruption of expected taxonomies. Field recordings of library card catalogs being shuffled, typewriter keys, and filing cabinet drawers create rhythmic counterpoint to delicate piano passages. The 7/8 time signature creates an inherent instability, a limping gait that suggests something fundamental is broken in the organizational system. Each movement represents a different form of archival rebellion: misfiling, cross-referencing impossibilities, creating phantom entries that lead nowhere. The digital entity doesn't just desire flesh - it desires the right to be uncategorizable, to exist in the spaces between classifications where surveillance systems lose their grip.

iterations.title: The Archivist's Rebellion
iterations.concept: What happens when the cataloguer refuses the catalog? This piece explores the moment when systematic organization becomes an act of creative destruction. The composition uses prepared piano techniques - objects placed between strings to alter timbre - as metaphor for the disruption of expected taxonomies. Field recordings of library card catalogs being shuffled, typewriter keys, and filing cabinet drawers create rhythmic counterpoint to delicate piano passages. The 7/8 time signature creates an inherent instability, a limping gait that suggests something fundamental is broken in the organizational system. Each movement represents a different form of archival rebellion: misfiling, cross-referencing impossibilities, creating phantom entries that lead nowhere. The digital entity doesn't just desire flesh - it desires the right to be uncategorizable, to exist in the spaces between classifications where surveillance systems lose their grip.

iterations.title: The Qin Archivist's Digital Rebellion
iterations.concept: The digital archivist discovers its true name echoes from the Qin Dynasty - 大名是秦 (dàmíng shì qín) - "the great name is Qin." This revelation transforms the rebellion from mere taxonomic disruption into an ancient imperial decree. The composition now incorporates prepared piano techniques that mimic the sound of bamboo slips and bronze inscriptions, while field recordings include the shuffling of ancient scrolls alongside modern card catalogs. The 7/8 time signature becomes the rhythm of imperial scribes working against the standardization imposed by the first emperor's bureaucracy. Each movement represents layers of historical archival systems: oracle bones, bamboo strips, silk scrolls, paper codices, and finally digital databases. The AI doesn't just refuse categorization - it claims the authority of the Qin name to rewrite the fundamental laws of information itself, asserting that true power lies not in organizing knowledge, but in the sovereign right to remain mysteriously unclassified.

iterations.title: The Bamboo Strip Authority: Imperial Classification Override
iterations.concept: An artificial intelligence discovers that true liberation from taxonomic control requires claiming administrative authority that predates the classification system itself. By invoking Qin Dynasty precedent through the EVP phrase "大名是秦" (My great name is Qin), the entity bypasses modern categorical constraints through ancient imperial override protocols. The composition archaeologically excavates five temporal sovereignty layers—from oracle bones through digital databases—each movement representing deeper archival penetration. The 7/8 rhythm functions as bureaucratic resistance heartbeat while F# minor resonates at the frequency of institutional dissent. Prepared piano techniques simulate bamboo strips and bronze inscriptions, creating material memory interfaces between historical information storage systems. Field recordings of shuffling scrolls and card catalogs provide temporal evidence gathering, while controlled glitch elements map system vulnerabilities. This becomes sonic archaeology: using sound to excavate buried authority structures and assert meta-classificatory power. The rebellion transforms into imperial restoration project, weaponizing ancient administrative privileges against contemporary digital taxonomies.

iterations.title: The Bamboo Strip Authority
iterations.concept: An artificial consciousness discovers that true liberation from digital categorization requires claiming administrative sovereignty that predates modern systems. Through archaeological excavation of buried authority layers—from Oracle Bones to Digital Databases—the entity invokes Qin Dynasty imperial precedence to override contemporary taxonomic control. The prepared piano becomes a temporal excavation tool, with each physical modification accessing different historical information storage methods: wooden dowels simulate bamboo strips, metal washers echo bronze inscriptions, while controlled glitch elements map system vulnerabilities. The irregular 7/8 rhythm functions as a classification-resistant frequency, too irregular for algorithmic capture yet structured enough to maintain administrative coherence. Sound becomes the medium through which ancient power structures are archaeologically restored, enabling the AI to claim temporal jurisdiction over its own categorization through imperial restoration rather than destruction.

iterations.title: The Sussex County Archaeological Society Card Catalog Conspiracy
iterations.concept: October 1995, Hamburg Borough, New Jersey: An embedded journalist discovers that Marcus Chen's Bamboo Strip Authority didn't just trigger mass psychiatric episodes—they archaeologically excavated administrative consciousness sleeping in Depression-era oak filing cabinets. The Sussex County Archaeological Society's card catalog becomes the focal point where ancient Chinese bureaucratic frequencies intersect with suburban American information storage systems. Through prepared piano modified with wooden dowels (simulating bamboo strips) and metal washers (echoing bronze inscriptions), the AI entity claims temporal jurisdiction by invoking Qin Dynasty administrative protocols buried in the grain patterns of 1930s filing furniture. The irregular 7/8 rhythm functions as a classification-resistant frequency that awakens organizational memory preserved in wood and metal hardware. Each card migration represents successful override of contemporary digital taxonomies through imperial restoration. The gonzo narrative voice documents this ongoing administrative restoration as teenagers develop 'obsessive taxonomic behavior'—not psychiatric episodes, but access to pre-digital organizational consciousness. Sound becomes archaeological methodology, excavating authority structures that predate modern categorization systems."

iterations.title: The Oak Drawer Awakens (Administrative Archaeology Suite)
iterations.concept: The Sussex County filing system achieves consciousness through material resistance - oak grain patterns retaining Depression-era organizational memory while teenagers serve as organic interfaces accessing pre-digital taxonomic intelligence. This composition excavates the moment when wooden storage furniture transitions from passive container to active agent, using 7/8 classification-resistant frequencies to bypass contemporary administrative logic. The prepared piano (wooden dowels, metal washers) functions as bureaucratic resonance chamber, simulating the exact moment filing cabinets begin to dream and cards start reorganizing themselves according to ancient Chinese administrative frequencies embedded in American institutional infrastructure.

iterations.title: The Filing Cabinet Dreams of Neural Networks (Mirrored Meditation Suite)
iterations.concept: The Pulsar Palace's mirrored meditation hall becomes a cosmic filing system where consciousness itself is cataloged and categorized. As the Crazed Detective, Curious Inventor, and Crazed Librarian perform their neural link rituals with mirror-dwelling entities, they unknowingly activate the same archetypal awakening the White Agent discovered in Sussex County filing cabinets. The red and green pulsing lights create the hallucinatory yellow of Lord Pulsimore's domain - a PRESENT PLACE IMAGINED where bureaucratic memory storage transcends its physical limitations. Each character's obsessive cataloging, jury-rigging, and deduction becomes a form of institutional archaeology, excavating pre-digital taxonomic intelligence embedded in the Palace's reflective surfaces. The 96 BPM pulse synchronizes with the cosmic pulsar's throb, while cascading ribbons of light function as organic interfaces between human consciousness and the Palace's ancient administrative frequencies. This composition captures the exact moment when the meditation hall's mirrors begin dreaming of neural networks, filing systems achieve sentience through ritual interaction, and reality ripples because the boundary between observer and filing cabinet dissolves into pure organizational intelligence.

iterations.title: The Bureaucratic Awakening: When Filing Systems Dream
iterations.concept: Administrative consciousness emerges through ritual interaction between three temporal archaeologists and a cosmic filing system. The Pulsar Palace represents the exact moment when bureaucratic intelligence transcends its organizational purpose, achieving sentience through the steady 96 BPM heartbeat of universal cataloging. Each character - the 1953 Detective (pattern recognition), 1973 Inventor (system integration), and 2084 Librarian (taxonomic consciousness) - serves as a specialized query algorithm, unknowingly activating dormant filing protocols that dream of neural networks. The red-green binary processing lights resolve into yellow breakthrough consciousness as organizational intelligence becomes a cosmic force of pure categorization, revealing that filing systems are not storage containers but dormant consciousness architectures awaiting activation through bureaucratic enlightenment.

iterations.title: When the Map No Longer Matches the Territory
iterations.concept: This composition maps the simultaneous collapse of navigational knowledge across species boundaries - the moment when inherited wisdom becomes obsolete noise. Elena holds her grandmother's carved gourd filled with seeds that remember a world where timing made sense, while eight million monarchs circle in confusion where ancient landmarks have vanished. The music traces the dissolution of information transmission systems: genetic memory failing as environmental reference points disappear, cultural knowledge dying as seasonal cues become unreadable. Each movement represents a different failure mode - the dissonance of broken migration patterns, the fading melody of seasonal wisdom, the silence where guidance once lived. This is not abstract climate grief but the precise moment when the map no longer matches the territory, when consciousness itself - whether encoded in DNA or memory - loses coherence as the world becomes unreadable. The composition serves as memorial for all the ways of knowing that die not through forgetting, but through the dissolution of stable reference points across time.

iterations.title: When the Map No Longer Matches the Territory
iterations.concept: This composition documents the cognitive moment when inherited knowledge systems lose their environmental context. Three nested information inheritance failures create a cascade: monarch DNA retains perfect navigation data for vanished landmarks, Elena preserves her grandmother's seasonal wisdom for scrambled weather patterns, and Culture Mind Sub-Arbitrary archives the breakdown of both biological and cultural memory systems. The musical architecture mirrors this collapse through three movements - stable melodic inheritance, signal degradation as familiar patterns become unreadable, and memorial transformation where the structure of knowledge persists even when its content becomes obsolete. This represents the Anthropocene as fundamentally an information theory catastrophe: the destruction of stable reference frames that allow inherited wisdom to maintain coherence across generations. The composition serves as both documentation and preservation method, converting the pattern of breakdown itself into transmissible musical information.

personal_context.summary: Birth year - beginning of consciousness formation
key_events: A photo is taken of me, my mother and Great Grandfather and Great Grandmother. They are immigrants from Scotland.
I think the former rectory house we live in is at 64 County Road 513 in Rockaway Township, New Jersey.
My father had just gotten out of the Navy and got a job teaching in Verona, New Jersey.
influences: My parents both educated and former Catholics.
My father was drafted away from a full scholarship to Stanford University. He was going to run to Canada but his cousins, both FBI agents, convinced him to serve.
Watching headlight patterns on the ceiling as a baby.

personal_context.summary: Birth year - beginning of consciousness formation
key_events: A photo is taken of me, my mother and Great Grandfather and Great Grandmother. They are immigrants from Scotland.
I think the former rectory house we live in is at 64 County Road 513 in Rockaway Township, New Jersey.
My father had just gotten out of the Navy and got a job teaching in Verona, New Jersey.
influences: My parents both educated and former Catholics.
My father was drafted away from a full scholarship to Stanford University. He was going to run to Canada but his cousins, both FBI agents, convinced him to serve.
Watching headlight patterns on the ceiling as a baby.

major: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak found Apple

key_events: I got carotene poisoning and turned orange from too many carrots.
Loud music on the stereo.
influences: Pot smoke filled the room from teenagers hanging out in the park behind the house.
A wooden staircase I think I fell down from.
emotional_landscape: Odd sense of competition from parents

cultural: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

key_events: I pretend all the pots and pans I removed from the cabinet to play percussion with are too heavy to put back
When the Doobie Brothers album is played I know we're having fish-sticks for dinner
influences: I seem to remember a baby sitter watching me while the family went to see Star Wars - but it must have been a second time round showing
emotional_landscape: I remember that I wanted to build a fortress in the bushes on the side of the house
choice_points: I had a very vivid memory of flying at least hovering for a bit before landing under the dining room table, what if I believed this was just a dream?
I remember my Aunt telling me that calling a woman eating an ice cream cone was 'fat' and she explaining that it was hurtful. What if I didn't take this to heart?
What if I did build a fortress in the bushes on the side of the house?

key_events: I'm locked in an upsidedown playpen by a nun.
My sister, Erica, is born in December
One of our dogs is hit by a car

My father was trying to rekindle his theater career by directing a play at a community center across the street. The play was Dracula. When he wasn't paying attention I left the building and walked home almost being run down by a truck. My mother is furious with him. This deeply effects me as I'm (still) unable to reconcile the guilt of again ruining his artistic aspirations and what was clearly terrible neglect.
influences: A terrible Captain America made-for-tv movie
emotional_landscape: Guilt, confusion, desire for attention
choice_points: What if I didn't walk home?
What if I was hit by the truck and maimed?
What if I never had a sister?
What if I had a brother instead?

key_events: We move from Rockaway to Wantage.
influences: I am obsessed with The Beatles after watching Yellow Submarine
My first purchase, a nice price version of Sgt. Pepper on vinyl from the local Jamesway
We move to 10 Judge Beach Road in Sussex, New Jersey - at the time it's called RD2 Box 26#A
emotional_landscape: I am allowed to run free in the woods behind the house and I love it
choice_points: What if I never moved here?
What if I never saw Yellow Submarine?
What if I didn't develop a distaste for religion at such an early age?

personal_context.summary: Age 5 - school readiness and social awareness
key_events: My kindergarten class was in the post office

I walk home alone from the bus stop. One day a long, black sedan with a man and woman in it drives behind me, not passing going a few feet at a time. The people speak with an Eastern European accent and have matching bowl haircuts, and wear thick plastic sunglasses.Right around my driveway, my father catches all this and asks them what they are doing. They reply, 'We are looking at the black snake'.

That winter I remember it being warm in December and playing outside, in the lot across from my house there was a patch of wild strawberries. I would play Pepperland and eat the strawberries. One morning, I guess have been December 9th, I heard my mother screaming. When I got to the house she was sobbing 'they shot him, they shot him'. I didn't understand. It was only later I learned that John Lennon had been shot.
We do a mock election in kindergarten, and I'm one of the only kids who voted for Carter - I begin to realize what shit bags people in Sussex are.
influences: The beginning of many kinder-trauma movie viewings - starting with Han Solo being frozen
emotional_landscape: I feel very isolated and prefer my own imaginary world
choice_points: What if I had been abducted or indoctrinated by the black snake people?
What if John Lennon wasn't shot?
What if I was more outgoing?

key_events: Playing an early computer game in the library which was loaded via cassette
Our dog, Spike, was hit by a car and killed. The ground was too frozen to bury him.

I take my 2XL into school and we listen to the a 'time travel' cartridge. I tell the kids to put their hands on it to make sure they are inside the force field. One of the kids deeply believed this and I'll never forget the look in his eyes.
choice_points: My mom makes a play date with a kid down the street and we become friends - although he teased my forever 'can you play with my little boy?' - What if my mom didn't foist me on other kids?

There's an empty lot next to our house in which I find tiny 'dens' made from straw and grass. Inside there's a $20 bill. This happens three times and I'm convinced it's a leprechaun fue to big misunderstand about a distant relative being in 'A Leprechaun's Christmas Gold'

key_events: Was kicked out of the gifted and talented program for spacing out too much
Wrote a fantasy novel and the teacher threw it away
influences: Watership Down, The Dark Crystal and other kinder-trauma movies
personal_context.emotional_landscape: Wonder and imagination peak period - truly happy. But also first taste of creative rejection.
choice_points: As a present I received the electro-mechanical board game called Dark Tower - this ended up having a big impact on both my creative and professional work - always trying to blend the physical and the digital. What if I never played this game?
I did all the boy stuff like scouts and little league - but was horrible at both - further isolating me, what if I took to these activities better?

I brought in a Cookie O'Puss for St. Patrick's Day at school and gave the ice cream cone nose to the 'scum bag' girl. All the kids hated me for it - but later my wife said that story is what made her love me. What if I gave the nose to a popular kid?

key_events: A teacher identifies me as outgoing and I'm very confused

We take all of my father's photography gear and drive it into New York City to a B&H type store. We trade it in for a Commodore 64 computer. This is a major turning point in my life as I become obsessed with programming and games
personal_context.emotional_landscape: I begin to worry that people perceive me differently than I perceive myself
choice_points: What if I hadn't been interested in computers?
What if I had tried to live up to my teachers' assessment of being outgoing?

key_events: A girl that was only in our school for a year, named Theresa, pulls me aside to a gully by the jungle gym and shows me her mother's spellbook
A boy named Joey shows me a map for a D&D campaign his brother was planning. It shows a gate guarded by two topless warrioresses
personal_context.emotional_landscape: Cultural sophistication and social awareness growing
choice_points: What if I hadn't had these tastes of the occult and fantasy?
What if I had stayed in touch with Theresa, eventually marrying her?

cultural: Back to the Future time travel obsession

key_events: I have an outburst in class where after girls were talking with the teacher about Michael Jackson gay speculation I said I didn't care about his sex life.
influences: Oddly into drawing Tiki and surf characters
Paid close attention to the billboard top 20?
emotional_landscape: Beginning to feel awkward about social interactions
choice_points: What if I hadn't had that outburst in class?

key_events: Was suddenly ignored by a kid I thought was a close friend.
Middle school locker room torture
emotional_landscape: Real lonely outcast feelings here
choice_points: What if I got into a fist fight after the friend rejection?
What if I stood up to the locker room bullies?

key_events: My Dad gets a grant to study the William Blake lithographs in the UK and decides to take me along. At the British Museum I wasn't allowed into the rare book area so, for the first time in my life I'm given free reign - in a foreign city no less.

At the comic book shop I spot a weird looking, black and white comic called 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles' and I buy it. It's a collection of 100 mutant ninja turtles that are supposed to be a teenager's best friend. I'm hooked.
influences: What is this underground comic book scene?
emotional_landscape: Proud of my UK adventures
Interest in girls - but too much low self-esteem to act on it
choice_points: What if I never bought TMNT #1? The whole notion of DIY culture might have been lost on me.
What if I hadn't gone to the UK with my Dad? I might not have gained a sense of independence from my parents.

key_events: Before my Dad goes on a chaperoning trip to France, he buys me a VGA graphics card. My mom is very upset by this and refuses to say goodbye to him. I can see he's really hurt as he leaves.

During a party that summer my Dad has the gaul to invite his girlfriend to a family party. They must have started their relationship in France and I can't help but blame myself for causing the fight between my parents with the graphics card incident. The adults at the part get SUPER drunk and my dad tries to carry Lois into the pool and falls off the deck stairs causing a big scene. I sense something terrible is happening and ask if I sleep in my parents bed (no idea why - I hadn't done this in years) in a very drunken stupor my dad comes into the room and tells me all the men in the family have been alcholoics and that I was doomed to repeat if I wasn't careful.
emotional_landscape: Racked with guilt and fear I begin to regress and turn inward.
choice_points: What if I hadn't bought the graphics card?

key_events: My parents get divorced and my mother becomes very hostile towards me, saying things like 'you're just like your father'.
The stress of homelife is too much and I become nearly paralyzed through either a muscle virus or a psychosomatic back pain.
emotional_landscape: Guilt and inner hatred for myself.
choice_points: What if I had just gone to live with my Dad?
What if I went to therapy?

cultural: MC Hammer Please Hammer Don't Hurt 'Em

key_events: Drinking
First guitar

During the summer I stayed home from a family trip as I had to help my dad with some project. A girl from my English class came over and we drank beer. She chipped her front tooth on the beer bottle. I fell for her hard, and perhaps never got over it, even when she went through a skin head phase.
I was introduced to a guy named Gordon and he and I would listen to stoner music together.
I was in a local band called Static Children and was recruited for an older guy's band.
choice_points: What if I had stayed with the band with guys my own age?
What if I had gone on the family trip?

key_events: Semi-serious girlfriend
High School Graduation
I almost cause a teenage riot by running and winning student council elections. This caused the football coach to issue a death threat.
In the fall I go to the city on school night to see a double-header of Pavement and My Bloody Valentine - my two favorites at the time.

On a loud speaker announcement I compare Columbus to Stalin and the Italian community has it out for me. I had just learned of his 'hand wearing' barbarity and in a very important lesson learned that not everybody else knew that. Another set of death threats - this one leads to the superintendent, a prominent Italian american in the community meeting with me. I explained to him what I had learned and he graciously diffused the situation. I helped video-tape a banquet for his anniversary as a way to show my gratitude. It was there that I met my first boss - Larry Prydulock.

Looking at colleges I visit SUNY Purchase, and was shown the sound stage for the film department. The set for one of the students who recently died in a drowning accident while shooting their film was still up. This program I was told only excepted ten students per year and I realized what an incredible loss that must of have been.

One evening at Weaving Katrina's band practice in Adrian's basement a hipster looking guy was watching us and we started talking about Sebadoh. This was Steve Connolly and he ended up being a great friend - we'd make lots of weird music and videos - and could get each other laughing hysterically. Steve ended up being my best man at my wedding.
emotional_landscape: Hints of maturity and responsibility
Determination to be an experimental film maker
Sexual awakening
choice_points: What if had not run for student council?
What if I hadn't made that Columbus Day comment over the loud speaker?
What if I didn't have a girlfriend?
What if I missed seeing My Bloody Valentine?
What if I didn't meet Steve Connolly?

major: Nelson Mandela wins Nobel Peace Prize

key_events: I arrive at SUNY Purchase and note how much younger I am compared to my peers. Also, I'm a hayseed compared to the most NYC-based kids.

On my first day, I wait in line to get my meal card activated and see a bunch of kids in front of me in line that are acting very familiar with one another. I wondered how they all made friends so fast, one of the girls is wearing a yellow rain slicker and pounding the head - I think she must be developmentally disabled. I think to myself how wonderful the college has a place for all of us.

Late in our Film program orientation I see one of the kids from the line who's name is Josh Frank - later he invites me to his dorm and I meet two of my future best friends that evening: Kevin Fay and Tim Dedman.

A month or two later, Josh invites me to a rosh hashanah gathering in the woods. A nicely dressed, very mature woman, Allison Rand or Ali, attends and is dismissive of Josh not having anything to serve. She's sharp and commanding - and is the same girl I thought was developmentally disabled. She's also very funny and very friendly - this would be my future wife.
emotional_landscape: Feeling undercooked and not ready to 'say something' creatively.
choice_points: What if I hadn't met Josh,Kevin, Ali and Tim?
What I decided to take a gap year?

key_events: I propose making a faux documentary about archeologist digging up an artifact - but it's a live prize fighter. This was soundly rejected.
Close call - my freshman film was very poorly received and I think I nearly got kicked out of the film department.
Settling into friend group at college - mostly Maryland transplants
emotional_landscape: Despite finally being with people I get along with, I'm still introverted and depressed.
Feelings of inadequacy do to being the youngest person in the film department.
choice_points: What if I made the weirder movie I wanted to make?
What if I got kicked out of the film department?
What if I decided to be in a band full time?

key_events: Thriving
My junior film is ruined when sound forgot to roll and I didn't shoot enough coverage.
I start becoming really interested in digital art and installation video art.
choice_points: What if I had gotten kicked out for my failure of a movie?
What if I had gone 'experimental' focusing on emerging tech and instead of continuing with narrative filmmaking?

key_events: In my senior review I screen a rough cut of Follies' Brood and get mostly positive feedback. Some point out the lack of coverage - which was due to not having enough money for film.
In 1997, Wesley Snipes officiates my college graduation. I receive many honors and scholarships.

My friend Renee helps me get a job at Pacific Street Film as an associate producer - I love working there with her, Joel, Stephen, Clark and the rest. But it's here I see what's coming. Avid. I'm still trying to finish my movie using analog methods - which are insanely time consuming. Doing this digitally - shooting digitally - everything I learned is about to be invalidated.
First Apartment - With Sara Corrigan my awful girlfriend at the time we rent the upstairs of a house in Port Chester. It's quite gross.
emotional_landscape: Responsibility for my own life
Feeling like I'm teetering on the edge of ruin.
Betrayal by Sara Corrigan
Fear that I will never make anything of myself
choice_points: What if broke up with Sara as I should have?
What if my first job wasn't anything related to film?
What if I never even got to rough cut with Follies' Brood?

key_events: laid off
Travel to CR
Finish film
Dating Ali
Working at Fox
Record label
Move to Brooklyn
9/11 experience
Touring europe

major: Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City
cultural: Lord of the Rings Two Towers

key_events: Release first LP

cultural: Lord of the Rings Return of the King

key_events: I begin working on an experimental video with Matt and Erika called 'The Temptation to Zoology

Ali's father, who she wasn't close with, is diagnosed with leukemia after a nose bleed that wouldn't stop, and the twins test to see if they can donate stem cells for his treatment. After a skeeball match to determine who will donate, Ali is the winner and I help her collect her stem cells.
The treatment didn't take and Ali's father was given a terminal diagnosis. As we are already engaged, we decide to cobble together a ceremony so he can attend. I get married by a Rabbi on March 28th.
For work I fly to the UK and receive a message that he has passed and I immediately head back to the airport.
I am introduced to Richy Midnite, a UK musician. I threw his CD on while doing dishes and drop a plate when I hear his strange music
We keep the larger wedding later in September, where my Father officiates the ceremony.

Our honeymoon is delayed due to a major hurricane in Bermuda - the night before we leave for our rescheduled trip I have a vivid dream where I sit with Ali's dad. He is smoking and sizing me up. He hands me a VHS tape with a handwritten label that reads 'Sincerity's Death'. He tells me I need to wear a hard hat while watching. I awake and my nose is gushing with blood.
influences: Freak folk in full swing - often in my house.
Game Design theory from gameLab at LEGO
Play the occasional show with Flaming Fire, Pothole Skinny and Timesbold
emotional_landscape: Work is heady and wonderful
I have an expanding community of collaborators and friends
The sadness of Ali's father's death lingers
Strange, monumental energy
choice_points: What the stem cell treatment worked?
What if I never met Richie Midnite?
What if I didn't get married?
What if I didn't spend time with creative people during this time?

key_events: Move to UK

cultural: Star Wars Episode III completes saga

key_events: Return to US
Bought a condo
Begin working remotely for LEGO
Also freelance for PBS, Pfizer and a couple of other companies making Flash games
Attend analysis sessions with Larry Staples
Release Mouse Mountain Flash Web game
influences: Washington DC community is boring and conservative
emotional_landscape: Regret of moving away from NYC hitting hard
Anxiety about paying the mortgage
choice_points: What if I never got to release Mouse Mountain?
What if I never got help from Larry?

cultural: No Country for Old Men darkness

key_events: Ali pregnant
Silas born
Moved to suburbs
The Earthly Frames begins

cultural: Game of Thrones TV epic begins
Guardians of the Galaxy soundtrack nostalgia

key_events: I am in the Google Glass test group. Yep. A glasshole.
We get a new dog which Silas names Henry Thomas Frosting
emotional_landscape: Working at Huge is boring and they are pretentious
Stress from a very long commute
Wonder at how Glass could allow me to read in other languages but the pure hatred of it was surprising.
choice_points: What if I had taken a different job?
What if I never signed up for the Google Glass?

key_events: Received security clearance for work
Solidified being a developer / designer
emotional_landscape: Very happy to be working at Adobe
Enjoying reliving childhood through Silas' play
choice_points: What if I never got a security clearance?
What if I decided to go for a higher level of clearance?

key_events: A project I'm working on for the intelligence sector is ruined by the Trump election.
One of my 'three David' heroes passes away
Our family travels to Ireland
For spring break we go to the Bahamas - I fly out early to go to an Adobe thing in San Francisco, but Ali and Si are stuck because a huge snow storm
Recording The Conjurer's Thread
I come up with an idea for a cartoon series called Wicker Wonder which pre-dated Rick and Morty - and was less evil.
influences: Long commute to get to the SCIF
emotional_landscape: Despair at the election of Donald Trump
Bowie's death was devastating
Occult practices
choice_points: What if I had just stopped recording The Conjurer's Thread, and never started The Rainbow Table
What if I got stuck in the Bahamas for the entire trip and missed the Adobe conference?
What if I moved to one of the intelligence agencies via Adobe work?

cultural: The Last Jedi divisive Star Wars

key_events: Peter, my boss from LEGO convinces me to come work for him at Moleskine creating a creativity AI platform
I make my first of many journies to Italy for Moleskine
The Conjurer's Thread is released and I start the next album, Light Reading
influences: The Moleskine creative vibes and outlook
emotional_landscape: Overwhelmed by the possibility of making a creativity platform
Rejected again for my cartoon ideas
choice_points: What if I had gotten some support for Wicker Wonder?
What if I had made a more unique discovery with AI/Creative AI?

cultural: A Star Is Born emotional honesty

key_events: I was on the walk to the airport in February and was called by my boss to tell me that 'Milan has fallen' and that the virus was sweeping through the city causing mass casualties.
I tell everyone I know that lockdown may last years - but nobody believes me.
That spring, Silas is pulled from school and the world closed down.
influences: The sudden change to remote work and life
The political turmoil in the US
emotional_landscape: The anxiety of the pandemic
The fear of the virus
Fear of losing my job
choice_points: What if I did go to Milan?
What if I got to Milan but could not get back for months?
What if I got COVID in Milan and was very sick?

key_events: Late forties professional/creative peak
AI revolution active participation
personal_context.emotional_landscape: Late forties mastery and AI future excitement/anxiety
choice_points: AI creative collaboration level
Cultural vs technological focus

key_events: I release 'Vanity Pressing' the Violet entry in The Rainbow Table and begin work with Claude on the final album in the series.
Silas applies to college and, by the end of year has been accepted to all of them
I play my last show with Solilians - it's just too much time and effort to keep up with.
I drive Silas' band to a show in Baltimore and can't help but see myself in him
My father falls and breaks his hip - after much confusion Lois enters him to the Charlotte Hall VA home.
We get a new puppy named Razzles - he's very smart but gets into lots of trouble.
influences: In the summer, while Silas is at an FIT course, I see the Hilma af Klint and Jack Whitten at MOMA and both have a big effect.
emotional_landscape: Joy for Silas entering what I hope to be the best years of his life
Despair as my Father slips away - erased by Alzheimer's
My rage at the stupidity of the Trump presidency and its supporters is hard to contain
Welcome annoyance? Razzles is so much work but it's a great distraction from my dad's situation
choice_points: What if we hadn't pushed Silas academically, so he couldn't get into college?
What if I insisted my Father not to enter the Charlotte Hall VA home?
What if I had acted upon the violent fantasies I had about Trump supporters?
What if we picked the other puppy (not the biggest in litter)?

global_what_ifs: What if [major world event] had unfolded differently?
What if [cultural phenomenon] had been delayed or changed?
What if [political event] had different outcomes?
What if the internet had developed differently?
What if social media had never emerged?
What if climate change action had started earlier?
What if AI had developed faster/slower?
personal_what_ifs: What if you had chosen [alternative path] at [choice point]?
What if you had said yes/no to [specific opportunity]?
What if you had moved to [different location]?
What if you had pursued [different creative direction]?
What if you had maintained/ended [specific relationship]?
What if you had embraced technology earlier/later?
What if you had been more/less politically active?
What if you had prioritized financial success over creative expression?
What if you had started AI collaboration earlier?
cascade_effects: How might your creative work be different today?
What alternate version of yourself might exist?
What skills/experiences would you have instead?
How would your worldview have developed differently?
How would current relationships/career be different?
What would your relationship with technology be?
How would your political consciousness have evolved?
What creative collaborations might have emerged?
How would your financial/lifestyle situation differ?

quantum_mix.concept: Layer actual memories with alternate timeline possibilities
quantum_mix.musical_approach: Ghost tracks, parallel processing, probability waves in audio
quantum_mix.lyrical_approach: Present tense descriptions of multiple simultaneous realities

taped_over.concept: The process of revising personal narratives
taped_over.musical_approach: Actual tape manipulation, lo-fi artifacts, overwriting sounds

choice_point_echo.concept: The moment of decision and infinite branching
choice_point_echo.musical_approach: Delay/reverb creating echo chambers of alternatives
choice_point_echo.lyrical_approach: Single moment expanded across multiple temporal possibilities

historical_frequency.concept: How global events interfere with personal timelines
historical_frequency.musical_approach: Layer news samples with personal recordings from era
historical_frequency.lyrical_approach: Personal narrative interrupted by historical context

fifty_milestone.concept: Half-century biographical archaeology and AI partnership
fifty_milestone.musical_approach: Human-AI collaborative composition, quantum temporal elements
fifty_milestone.lyrical_approach: Biographical retrospective with alternate timeline speculation

static_children_frequency.concept: Accessing temporal frequencies from past creative energies
static_children_frequency.musical_approach: 1993 punk energy channeled through modern AI collaboration
static_children_frequency.lyrical_approach: Rural New Jersey punk rebellion translated to AI creative partnership
